definitions.title: n. f.
definitions.body: (v. infr.) sₑ’āh, a measure of flour, grain, etc. (√ unknown; perh. foreign word; NH id.; Aram. [[סְאָה]], [[סָאתָא]], so0o0, se0o0, sa0to0 (Gk. sa/ton, Lewy:Fremdwörter 116 f));—abs. [[סְאָה־]] 2Ki 7:1; 2Ki 7:16, [[וּסֳאָה־]] v:2Ki 7:18 (Baer Ginsb cf. Ges:§ 10 h); du. [[סָאתַיִם]] 1Ki 18:32 + 3 t.; pl. [[סְאִים]] Ge 18:6, 1Sa 25:18; —alw. c. appos. of thing measured, Ge 18:6 (J), 1Sa 25:18, 1Ki 18:32, 2Ki 7:1, 2Ki 7:1, 2Ki 7:16, 2Ki 7:16, 2Ki 7:18, 2Ki 7:18 (where appar. masc., perh. after anal. of other measures of capacity, [[הִין]], [[תׂמֶר]], [[כּׂר]], etc., Albrecht:ZAW xvi (1896), 95);—[[סַאסְּאָה]] Is 27:8 v. [[סאסא]].—On size of sₑ’āh = 1/3 ephah, = 12.148 litres (= 10.696 qts.), v. Now:Arch. i. 203 Benz:Arch. 183.
